title: Anthony Joshua v Wladimir Klitschko: Brit gets acupuncture
title_page: Anthony Joshua v Wladimir Klitschko: Brit gets acupuncture | Daily Mail Online
text:
The countdown has begun in earnest ahead of the biggest fight of Anthony Joshua's professional career and he is preparing by any means necessary.
The Watford-born heavyweight posted a video to social media of him undergoing acupuncture treatment as he trains to fight Wladimir Klitschko.
It is not the first time the boxer has undergone the treatment - he previously revealed, before fighting Eric Molina in his last bout, that he had 950 needles inserted into his body.
Scroll down for video
Boxer Anthony Joshua posted a video of himself getting acupuncture as part of training
Joshua is preparing for a heavyweight clash with Wladimir Klischko on April 29
Klitschko paid tribute to his physio, Rob Madden, for giving him the treatment
WHAT EXACTLY IS ACUPUNCTURE? According to the NHS website, acupuncture - derived from ancient Chinese medicine - involves fine needles inserted in certain places in the body for 'therapeutic purposes'. The needles stimulate sensory nerves under the skin and in the muscles, producing pain-relieving endorphins. Acupuncture is used to relieve headaches and joint pain.
The 24-year-old said at the time: 'It was 98 days in camp, 392 organic meals, 28 physio sessions, 210 protein shakes, 42 strength sessions and 98 fish oils. I had acupuncture, that is 950 needles in my body.
'There were 660 rounds of sparring and 210 miles of running. I weigh 249lb. That's the biggest and strongest I've been, and I will do it until my body cannot physically do it.'
Joshua gave a shout out to his physio, Rob Madden, in the video, which sees Madden inserting the needles into the fighter's side.
He captioned the video: 'Still up working, thanks to @robmaddenpt for putting up with me. Real G.'
Joshua will make the third defence of his IBF heavyweight belt on April 29 in front of 90,000 people at Wembley stadium.
